page.title: 09ISOLATION HOSPITAL
page.content: Situated off the quiet Henwood Lane is the Isolation Hospital. It was built at the beginning of the century to care for victims of Scarlet Fever. Later it became an extension for Solihull Hospital Maternity Unit in the 1950's. Later it was used to have refugee's from the war in Indo-China. It was last used in 1981 to isolate two smallpox victims, a father and daughter. The daughter, a technician at Birmingham University later died, but her father survived. At present the hospital remains empty, but is looked after by a warden and his wife.
